intro: Elytropappus cernuus, commonly known as the bent-leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
